titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Flor Guinhawa Filipino-American history books and gala programs, 2006-2016 MS 846
titlestmt.author: Mary Tobin

publicationstmt.publisher: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

note.p: Stored onsite at the Woodson Research Center.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-04-02 01:30:02 -0500.

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.corpname: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

did.unittitle: Flor Guinhawa Filipino-American history books and gala programs
did.abstract: 21 bound event programs, 2006-2016, and 12 books to be cataloged separately with the following note: Gift: Donated by Flor Guinhawa, of the Philippine-American Chamber of Commerce Texas, via the Chao Center for Asian Studies, Rice University.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Flor Guinhawa is a prominent member of the Filipino-American community in Texas. He holds the position of State Deputy Director of the Philippine-American Chamber of Commerce Texas. He is known for philanthropy in enabling Philippine students to pursue educational goals.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of 21 bound programs from celebratory events of a variety of Filipino-American organizations, spanning the years 2006 to 2016, and 12 books to be cataloged separately.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This material is open for research.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Flor Guinhawa, of the Philippine-American Chamber of Commerce Texas, via the Chao Center for Asian Studies, Rice University and via Christy Poisot.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The materials are arranged in a single general series, by date.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: The Flor Guinhawa Filipino-American history books and gala programs, MS 846, Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University, Houston, Texas.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Books being catalogued separately: Marcos, Ferdinand E., The Democratic Revolution in the Philippines, Foreword by Carlos P. Romulo Laurel, Jose P., Days of Our Years: The Laurel Legacy Laurel, Jose P., Quotes of Jose P. Laurel Laurel, Salvador H., Neither Trumpets nor Drums: Summing Up the Cory Government Pedrosa, Carmen Navarro, Imelda Marcos: The Rise and Fall of One of the World's Most Powerful Women White, Mel, Aquino: The Untold Story! Ninoy and Cory Aquino's Journey of Faith White, Mel, Aquino: Bagong Bayani: Inspiring Filipinos Overseas, Book One White, Mel, Aquino: Bayai Ko! White, Mel, Aquino: Beat the Odds: Another Stone for the Edifice White, Mel, Aquino: John Paul II: Papal Visit 1995 Manila White, Mel, Aquino: Maps and Views of Old Manila

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the Flor Guinhawa Filipino-American history books and gala programs must be obtained from the Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University, Houston, Texas.
